image.altText: A smashed up shop counter and cards on the floor of a shop

props.synopsis: Card game store owners say there has been a spike in break-ins at shops across Melbourne where people are stealing piles of Pokemon cards in wheelie bins.

title.children: Police investigate burglaries at Pokemon card stores across Melbourne

image.altText: A school zone sign

props.synopsis: The report found a now-convicted teacher was allowed to keep working for years after they were was seen inappropriately touching a student.

title.children: Damning report finds Victorian education department failed sex abuse victims

image.altText: John Lister wearing a dark coloured polo shirt standing in front of some greenery,.

props.synopsis: Labor candidate John Lister is on track to win the Werribee by-election, having increased his narrow lead with the counting of further postal votes on Thursday.

title.children: Labor poised to retain seat of Werribee following tight by-election race

image.altText: Pesto and Pudding stands side-by-side with beaks together.

props.synopsis: Pesto, the viral sensation and globally famous penguin, is being observed cosying up to penguin-friend Pudding. Could it be love?

title.children: Pesto the penguin seen 'canoodling' with a friend

image.altText: Child's hand being held by an adult

props.synopsis: Protection from family violence is a postcode lottery and children should be allowed to apply for their own family violence orders, a parliamentary inquiry into the system has found.

title.children: Should kids get their own family violence orders? This report says yes

image.altText: Mum and child looking at toddler food products in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: A new report has found that parents are being duped by food manufacturers into buying unhealthy foods for their kids.

title.children: 'Deeply concerning' marketing being used to sell parents unhealthy food for their toddlers

image.altText: A hems helicopter flies against a white sky

props.synopsis: A man has died and a toddler has been flown to hospital with life-threatening injuries after being rescued from a house fire in central Victoria.

title.children: Man dies, child in critical condition after Maryborough house fire

image.altText: Shane Patton looks at the camera with an intense expression.

props.synopsis: The Chief Commissioner of Victoria Police, Shane Patton, says he wants to serve another term in the role despite losing the support of some union members over his handling of a pay dispute.

title.children: Victoria's top cop says he won't resign despite looming confidence vote

image.altText: Brielle holds her daughter as she looks off a balcony.

props.synopsis: Apartment living is a key pillar of government plans to ease the housing crisis by densifying well-connected parts of Australia's largest cities. But some have questioned the viability of the plans, saying the current stock of apartments was poorly suited for families.

title.children: Could a high-rise apartment replace the classic family home?

image.altText: A man, a woman, and three school children stand in front of a school.

props.synopsis: Parents want a government rethink on a "rigid" rule forcing Manangatang P-12 College students to evacuate 50 kilometres away on hot, extreme fire risk days.

title.children: Rural students to evacuate on extreme fire risk days even when there's no fire

image.altText: Barongarook fires

props.synopsis: Firefighters are battling multiple bushfires in south-west Victoria as Melbourne braces for potential thunderstorms as a cold front approaches.

title.children: South-west Victoria residents told to stay informed after day of fires

image.altText: Eggs on a conveyor belt passing below chooks in cages.

props.synopsis: Victoria's peak farming body says the conventional caged egg system has been in place since the 1960s and shoppers have come to rely on it.

title.children: Victorian farmers plead for pause on caged egg phase out

image.altText: Brayden Craig is seen walking in front of a bar in Thailand at night.

props.synopsis: A fraudster who has run scams against Australians for more than two decades has resurfaced at the centre of a dispute over patents potentially worth more than $21 billion.

title.children: 'He disappears, changes his name': Chasing a fraudster

image.altText: Green paddocks with wind turbines and a blue sky

props.synopsis: Fourteen wind turbines will be removed from Victoria's south-west coast and will not be replaced because it's understood only four turbines would fit on the site under current standards.

title.children: One of Australia's first wind farms faces decommissioning due to cost

image.altText: A young elephant

props.synopsis: It took five days for a team to transport nine Asian elephants across Melbourne to a new home in Werribee.

title.children: How Zoos Victoria moved elephant herd to new home across the city

image.altText: A shop-front window and double doors are covered in political advertising.

props.synopsis: A federal politician with two offices has used taxpayer funding to open a third. The catch? It's completely empty, and by the politician's own admission "clearly a billboard".

title.children: The mystery of MP's empty office that has allegedly 'broken the rules'

image.altText: headshot of Liam Neeson

props.synopsis: Northern Ireland-born superstar Liam Neeson hits regional Victoria for The Mongoose, his third film in the state in four years.

title.children: Hollywood action star wows fans ahead of Victorian shoot for new movie

image.altText: A man waving a Palestine flag walking in front of a group of protesters with flags and signs.

props.synopsis: Organisers of Melbourne's pro-Palestine rallies will now focus on monthly demonstrations as Gaza ceasefire deal comes under threat.

title.children: After 70 weeks, Melbourne's pro-Palestine rallies will wind back

image.altText: A bouncer standing next to an ID scanner takes ID off patron.

props.synopsis: Privacy advocates and cybersecurity experts say the growing use of ID scanning at venues raises the risk of personal data breaches. They argue a more ambitious overhaul of privacy laws is needed.

title.children: A photo of your passport, face, and a biometric match — all to get a drink

image.altText: Lady of justice statue outside Brisbane's Supreme and District Courts building.

props.synopsis: The 15-year-old boy pleaded guilty to a range of offences including armed robbery and assault with a weapon.

title.children: Bail denied for teenager who attacked stranger with machete in Melbourne

image.altText: A glass pipe used to smoke meth.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police allegedly found phones, cash and 10kg of meth in a car driven by a 20-year-old who is expected to face court today.

title.children: Young man charged after $3m worth of meth found in car

image.altText: Damage after the fire in Pomonal in February 2024

props.synopsis: One year after a devastating bushfire destroyed more than 45 properties in the western Victorian town of Pomonal, a mental health support service is seeing a new increase in people seeking help.

title.children: One year on, bushfire-ravaged town seeks more mental health support

image.altText: Two intruders break into a home looking for car keys.

props.synopsis: Amid increasing public frustration and anger about youth crime, Victoria's latest statistics show youth crime is at record levels and police are blaming repeat offenders.

title.children: Car thefts by youths are on the rise. Offenders are breaking into homes to steal them

image.altText: Firefighters kneel and walk around equipment laid out on a red tarp outside a building saying ACB Group.

props.synopsis: ACB Group, which owns the factory that twice caught fire in Melbourne's west, including a fire that left a worker dead, has entered voluntary liquidation owing creditors $5.3 million.

title.children: Company at centre of major factory fires collapses owing millions

image.altText: A V/Line train is stopped on railway tracks. Nearby an excavator is overturned and a large truck trailer is bent.

props.synopsis: Several passengers have been injured in a crash between a truck and a V/Line passenger train at Kilmany, near Sale, in Victoria's east.

title.children: Seats ripped out, passengers injured as train and truck collide

image.altText: Egg supermarket shelves empty

props.synopsis: Consumers are still facing egg shortages and price rises as the ramifications of Australia's largest bird flu outbreak continue to be felt.

title.children: Why is there still an egg shortage on some supermarket shelves?

image.altText: Jacinta Allan looks serious at an outdoor press conference.

props.synopsis: A major swing against Labor in the Werribee by-election and a victory for the Liberal Party in Prahran may be a major warning for the Allan government.

title.children: After the Super Saturday of by-elections, alarm bells are ringing for Labor

image.altText: A black and white photo of Philip Brady holding a record

props.synopsis: Radio presenter and TV identity Philip Brady has died days after announcing his retirement.

title.children: Media personality and radio presenter Philip Brady dies, aged 85

image.altText: The intersection of two regional roads.

props.synopsis: Afghan national Jafar Bunyad died after he fell from a moving tractor in north-west Victoria. The company that employed him has been fined for failing to provide proper instruction and training.

title.children: Court fines labour hire company after fruit picker dies on second shift

image.altText: A car and two silouhettes

props.synopsis: A group of teenagers have allegedly threatened a driver at knife point before stealing their car while evading police in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Victorian teens arrested following spate of burglaries and carjackings

image.altText: A woman stands next to a waffle iron

props.synopsis: Chef Manjit Kaur, a skilled visa holder, wants permanent residency in Victoria but her boss says Australia's "broken" migration system might see her deported.

title.children: Country cafe 'forced' to cut hours as three chefs face deportation

image.altText: Matthew Stafford prepares to throw the ball for the LA Rams in an NFL match.

props.synopsis: The NFL confirms it will play its first regular-season match in Australia at the MCG next year, with the Los Angeles Rams to feature in the historic occasion.

title.children: Melbourne to host NFL match at MCG in 2026 as part of multi-year commitment

image.altText: flooding near house and hedge

props.synopsis: Severe weather warning as "unusual" low-pressure system drives downpours across parts of Victoria since yesterday, the Bureau of Meteorology says.

title.children: Flash flooding warnings as storms dump heavy rain in Victoria's east

image.altText: Woman wearing grey sweat shirt standing in front of outdoor enclosure with magpies

props.synopsis: A number of volunteer rescuers are accusing the state's largest wildlife rescue organisation of being too slow when responding to cases, and for silencing members who raise issues.

title.children: Former volunteers at odds with Wildlife Victoria over animal rescues

image.altText: Seb O Halloran

props.synopsis: Defence lawyers for the teenager accused of murdering Victorian man Seb O'Halloran have told a court that she had reason to fear him and believed he was dangerous.

title.children: Death of Mildura man Seb O'Halloran was self-defence, court hears
